Name: Rohit B
Title: A very holy dip!
Review: It is believed that a dip in Chakra Tirtha at Naimisharanya is equivalent to doing all the religious sites in the country. The water is clean and temperature is mildly warm, thus it is very convenient to take a holy dip.

Name: Tanvi
Title: Nice
Review: It is believed Lot Vishnu's chakra fell in this river . It is nice one most visit here if they are in Lucknow .

Name: Ajay T
Title: Excellent history
Review: Very relaxing place, this temple having very old history. People are believed that Lord Vishnu's Chakra was fallen at this place that is why place is called Chakra tirth temple. But there are so many other temple must watch them. We really enjoyed the trip.

Name: Pushpendra M
Title: NICE
Review: I always love to visit temple. Its really great experience here. Very Peaceful place for everyone. Must visit here.

Name: contact2vishal
Title: Holy Place to visit
Review: This is ancient forest mentioned in the Mahabharata and the puranas. It lay on the banks of the Gomti RiverNamisharnya (Nimasar) is mentioned in Hindu mythology associated with Lord Brahma, Lord Vishnu, Devi Sati and Lord Shiva. This place is unique due to the belief that there are 33 Hindu Goddesses of Goddesses. It is considered to be the most sacred of all the pilgrim center of the Hindus. It is said that if someone performs penance for 12 years on this ground then it goes to Brahmalok. This place is located in Sitapur district, 94 km from Lucknow on the banks of river Gomti. This place is mentioned in the form of a dense forest in many ancient texts, including the Mahabharata. To see the various temples here, one day's journey is definitely worthwhile.

Name: Vipin Arora
Title: Nice place
Review: Naimisharanya is known to be a sacred place for Hindus as nearly 80000 sages did their penance here and worshipped the supreme lord . Chaktateerth is considered to be holy waters and a dip is recommended. There are some small temples around the campus . The only trouble is pandits trying to get money from you by getting sankalpa from you . Though it's not that they ask you hundreds of rupees , even 10 rupees is okay but the pestering is a bit irritating .

Name: Rohit T
Title: Sacred for Hindus
Review: Around 90 km from Lucknow, you have to to drive down from Lucknow to Sitapur Road. After 50 km at Sidhauli, take a left tun, continue for 35 km till you reach Kalli Crossing. Then 10 km from there and you reach Neemsaar. Visit this holy place for about an hour and then you can go to nearby Lalita Devi temple and Vyaas Gaddi

Name: Karthik R
Title: Religiously important place
Review: Chakra Thirth - For the need of sages, Lord Brahma sent his Chakra - Manomaya Chakra to identify a spot for them to meditate. The Chakra settled at a deserted place and addressed the Saints that, this place by the banks of river Gomati. It is believed that there is no other holy place, as this one in this entire universe. Chakra-Theertha is said to be the center of the universe. It is said that the large sweet-water spring that marks the location of Chakra-Theertha has no bottom. It is said that by taking bath in Chakra Theertha, sins of 10 earlier generations and 10 future generations will also vanish. We did not take bath here and moved on with the prokshanam of the water.

Name: Gohel D
Title: Doesn't show correct location by ur app
Review: Doesn't show correct location through ur app. Please rectify. We were planed to visit this place and went today by uber as per shown  ur app but ur app and uber app both doesn't not show correct location of this place. I request u please correct this errors because save time of travellers.

Name: Ramaswami V
Title: Naimisaranyam visit
Review: We went to Naimisaranyam, one of the 108 divyadesams of Sri Vishnu and visited important places there, including the South Indian vishnu temple and Ahobila Mutt.   It was a Saturday and the place was very busy with people and activities.  Lots of religious history shared by pundits.  Great place to visit

Name: Jaspal_Singh
Title: Wonderful Place
Review: Very nice and unique place, where one do parikarma doing the dip. Conveniences around to change and do religious chores. Be careful of self solicting religious people as they can fleece you  in the name of your pitra/punya karma/bla bla..Nevertheless great place to sit/meditate/move around and take holy dip.

Name: KRAMA200
Title: Sacred Dip
Review: Chakra Thirth is situated about Eighty Kms from Lucknow in Sitapur Lucknow Highway.It is believed that Chakra Tirth was the place where the 'Chakra' of the Hindu god Brahma stopped and went inside the earth, declaring that particular spot to be holy.  and epicenter of UniverseAnother version of the myth associates the place with the 'Sudershan Chakra' of the popular Hindu god Vishnu. Many devotees visit this place to have a holy dip in the cChakra Teertha to ward off your sins. One of the must visit places for Vaishnavas

Name: Gurumurthy Bhargava
Title: Pilgrimage......continues
Review: Chakra tirth  is located about 90 kms from Lucknow off Sitapur Lucknow highway.This place is revered as the holiest place to wash all sins by having a customary dip.There are many teertham (Holy water bodies) in India but this place has its own significance.The circular tank has two concentric circles the central circle is forbidden for bathing.As per custom one has to donate gold or silver item in the central pond as written on the perimetry  wall.  The day I Visited  was close to Dusshera hence was crowded.Only if the management takes  a lesson from TTD this place can be outstanding.Another thing which the management can improve is free this place from the priests who are busy fleecing gullible pilgrims which at times is annoying . However, must for devoted Hindus.

Name: Ramana G
Title: Sacred Place
Review: Visited Chakra Tirth Temple for  a short duration for its significance in our mythology. Easily accessible from Lucknow (2 hours drive). Performed pooja at Shiva temple after taking holy dip in chakra tirth

Name: Vibhu S
Title: Chakra Tirth Temple
Review: This is place of Chakra Tirth Temple near a neem Saar in Sitapur place and this holy place and around water flow

Name: Srinivas K
Title: Salvation
Review: A place filled with pilgrim spots. There is a definite need to avoid the half baked pandits. A reading of the Mahabharata and Ramayana before visiting will do a world of good. The water in Chakra Teerth is refreshing. Though new moon day and full moon day are considered auspicious for a visit would suggest any other day for a refreshing visit. Needs a lot of upgradation.

Name: vinitasaraf2015
Title: Holy Pool
Review: It is said a dip in the holy pool is very beneficial. Lots of small temples located here. Overall very peaceful and calming

Name: qahead123
Title: Aastha ki dubki
Review: Aastha ki dubki is a must at this place. This is the holiest place on earth for hindues. Also th eplace has a shaktipheet nearby, so a must go .

Name: DhirajJurno
Title: One of the most revered pilgrimage place of UP
Review: Located in Sitapur district of UP, Nemisharan is a holy place a visited by thousand of devotees everyday.  Nemisharan mela and fair is also very famous among the people of UP. its pond hold holy significance people come here to take a holy dip into it with their family

Name: ansangam
Title: Chakra Tirth Temple, a place of activities
Review: At Chakrathirth there is a round shaped holy water pond where you will find People taking  bath  and worshiping . The pond  is surrounded by some age old  temples.   It is believed that Chakra threw by Brahma , went inside the earth at this place creating a  large water source developed at this place .Godess Lalita Devi  regulated the flow of water to establish the  Chakratirth .  Number of people visit this holy place, particularly on Somvati Amavasya.

Name: vikashvikki92
Title: much beautiful spot
Review: I visited this Place with my friends in the 2nd of October 2016.  It is in Out Of Lucknow, Its at Nemisharan in Sitapur. Really we are Enjoying very much this place. - Vikas TrivediLaxmanpur, Trivediganj (B.B.K)

Name: Saurabh M
Title: It is devotional place of hindu
Review: it is in outer lucknow and that place known as bakshi ka taalab.it is a peaceful place and filled with crowed while hindu festivals

Name: Vijaypsingh81
Title: Nice Temple
Review: I visited this Temple with my family in the beginning of October 2016, The overall ambience of the Temple is good, and has great religious values

Name: Dharmendra S
Title: Nice Place containing history of ancient time of India
Review: This is one of the holiest place for Hindus as it is famous for chakra teerth. Its at Nemisharan in District Sitapur. Around 80 KM from Lucknow. Nice place. I visited this place many times as this is only 10 KM from my village. Must see lot of temples at this place. Rishi Dadhichi was from this place.

Name: Manish B
Title: Divine
Review: Ancient temple and very important pilgrim place of hindus. The place is said to very old and very important. Many people visit the temple daily. Must visit place and worship.

Name: abhayverma2007
Title: Holy place
Review: I recently visited this place. Its a temple along with holy chakra. People says that this chakra is rotating but the fact is that the water inside the chakra is rotating because people are moving inside the water.

Name: Abhishek S
Title: I belong to SITAPUR, I have visited many times to Naimish, Its really a great place for devotion
Review: I belong to SITAPUR, I have visited many times to Naimish, Its really a great place for devotion I belong to SITAPUR, I have visited many times to Naimish, Its really a great place for devotion I belong to SITAPUR, I have visited many times to Naimish, Its really a great place for devotion

Name: Sachin G
Title: Must Visit - Ancient Place
Review: This is a place which is written in Vedas, Vyas Gaddi is also there and Lalita Mata Temple is one of the oldest temple in India.. With River Gomti and peaceful atmoshpere one can enjoy mindset peace...

Name: travellerasr1407
Title: Serenity at its best
Review: Very serene environment here, and beautifully made temple, visited here with family and spent couple of hours in Peace and with God

Name: Shri Krishan Kansal
Title: Satnarain Katha Origion
Review: A place in Hindu religion where Sukji bhagwan preached this katha to 84000 rishis for the first time on the request of Maharishi Vedvyash and a place where Barhmaji visited earth and a water kund originated the depth of which is unknown and out of bound for everyone. The place needs to be maintained properly and administration should develop it as a religious tourism place.

Name: pazhani
Title: Good pilgrimage place
Review: Good pilgrimage place to enthrall the good oldies tradition. Though pundits are money minded, it is our interest to keep them or leave.

Name: SjAwadh
Title: An ancient holy place !!
Review: 1. This place is almost an hour drive from Lucknow and located in district Sitapur.2. The distance is around 85 km and it is on road leading to left at N.H.24 at a place called Sidhauli on Lucknow- Delhi Highway.3. The place got mentions in ancient Hindu scriptures and is believed that Lord Brahma himself identified this place for sages to perform meditation and prayers in unabated way.4.The Chakra Tirth temple is established at that very place where wheel or Chakra of Lord Brahma stopped in search of ideal area.5. Here a holy pond or Chakra Tirth came into existence and depth of this pond is considered unfathomable and crossing of the inner circle is not allowed.6. Devotees come here to take dip in holy waters and to get rid of sins and after that worship in surrounding temples .7. The problem here is the presence of too many local priests who are not ready to spare anyone and think that only they can show way to please God.8.The maintenance of place is not good and as the place has so much religious significance this needs more attention.9. There are more temples near this place which should be visited like temple of Goddess Lalita Devi which is one of Shakti peeth  and other one is Hanuman temple where it is believed brother of Ravan named Ahiravan kept Ram and Laxman in captivity and Hanumanji freed them .10. Neemsar or Naimisharnya is a sacred place in Hindu mythology and visit to this place should be adhered in that way.

Name: gayatriPune
Title: Chakratirth
Review: I visited Naimisharanya for Bhagavat katha. So 1st thing we visited Chakratirth. It  is very significant for those who believe in Bhagavat .

Name: vaida17
Title: very interesting
Review: visited on 19th morning.  very crowded.  very pious, but maintained very dirty.  the pandas are money freedy and fleecing the visitors, with all sorts of gimmicks and religious stories

Name: Manish178
Title: A place full of cheats
Review: It is said that Nemisharanya has been mentioned in the Vedic literature. I am not sure about the historical credibility of this place. But one thing that repulsed me was the crooks in the garb of priests loitering around and trying to extort money out of you. At a place of faith such acts so nothing but degrade the grace of the place itself, and that is what happened with me.

Name: satyaprakash375
Title: Nemisharan
Review: Nemisharan is situated in Sitapur, there are  many other temples like Hanuman Ghadi ,Dadhich Kund etc

Name: plpalani
Title: Sacred place with long tradition
Review: It is believed that Chakra teerth is created by the centre of the chakra created by Brahma' s heart it is believed to be the centre of earth. It is the God of earth.taking bath or sprinkling the holy water erases all sin.

Name: Shruti_Poki
Title: Holy Place!
Review: The place is known as neemsharanya also.It is a divine place and land of god.It’s believed that taking dip in holy water relives you from all sinsWe sat on the stairs leading to the pond.Just be careful as it’s very slippery the stairs near water and you may fall down in water getting injured.There are changing rooms available near the pond.It was a good experience to be at a place of such religious importance.

Name: Nipurn B
Title: Nice place of religious importance
Review: Chakra tirath temple is a very old religious place.it is said that the water in the chakra comes from base of the earth or patal lok as said well.There is a religious tradition to have a dip in water and take rounds( parikrama) around.Though the water I suppose is not at all clear as it seems very dirty still lot of people take a dip in water.the temple beside is small but good.Only point is that pandits sitting there will try to grab more and more money from youBy putting a amount donated against your name forcefully which you need to take care of and be cautious.

Name: manoj g
Title: Must see temple in Lucknow
Review: It is a very holy place for Hindus and a must see for all tourists. Most of the hindus visit this temple for Pinddan. This is a very old temple and has a special significance in our Hindu Mythology.

Name: raks125
Title: good
Review: it;s worth visiting this place. this has good good connectivity. one can offer puja to the the god with the help of pujari.

Name: guddu1954
Title: a holy place -must visit
Review: a very holy place for hindus.people go there for a number of reasons-the most important is Pinddan.nearby there are many places worth seeing.

Name: DotDivx
Title: Nice temple
Review: One should visit if a person has a spiritual inclination. It is a old temple and has a special significance in the Hindu mythology.

Name: rnraghavan
Title: Naimisaranya
Review: Chakra Tirth has a special siginificance in the Hindu mythology and the place gives that feel. A circular pond with temples all around it. Few other important shrines nearby like the Ahobila Mutt, Lalita Devi temple, Vyas Kund, etc.

Name: Pawan_Shrotria
Title: One of the Most Sacred Hindu Pilgrimage
Review: Chamra Teerth is about 70 kms from Lucknow and is one of the most sacred Hindu Pilgrimage.There is also a famous and 'Siddh' Hanuman Temple just about 1 kilometres far from chakra teerth. Do not forget to go there also.To my surprise the temple is Air-conditioned.

Name: MSaksham
Title: Nice
Review: Known as Naimisharanya ,is situated in Sitapur.You can go there,depends on your faith.But one thing you need to be aware of is ,that most people are thugs there.Even if you go inside a temple then panditji would stare you like anything and would ask you openly to donate at least 1000 INR(mostly).And also the time I visited there ,no hotel was available to get food to eat.Some dhaba kind only you can get with some selected range to choose food from.

Name: NanditGupta
Title: Temple at Sitapur
Review: Chakra Teerth also known as Neemsaar is situated in Sitapur near Mishrik There are many other temples like Hanuman Ghadi ,Dadhich Kund etc It's approx 100 kms from Lucknow

Name: MOHAMMED MOHSIN
Title: best experience
Review: Seen residency, kaisarbagh, aminabad, maulaviganj, nakkhas, malihwbad, hazratganj, drm office, passport office, reserve bank of India, fun republic mall gomti Nagar, alambagh, amausi airport, malihabad's mangos.

Name: swarnaprabha k
Title: positive  energy  and  positive  vibes  everywhere
Review: I  have  heard  many  a  times  about   Naimisar     in  mythological   stories   .    I  was  told  to  visit  that  place  during  our  Lucknow  visit   by  a  relative  .  so  we  travelled  the  distance  by  a  taxi  .  it  is  a  serene  place  ,  with  positive  energy  , positive  vibes  every  where  .  I    felt  the  Vibrations ,  received  through  chanting  of   about  80,000/-  sages like  Bysa  ,  Manu  many  many  years  ago . it  was  more  to  feel  than  to  see .the sacrad  places  incudes  the  Hridyalalita , Tripurasundari  temple , the  Byass  gaddi ,Hanuman  temple ,  beda  sangraha ,  suka muni  ,  parashara  muni  and  their  Tapasthali .
